intro: Ayapanopsis didyma, commonly known as the twin-flower ayapanopsis, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. Ayapanopsis didyma is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and partial shade.
